discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Simple way to look at it:
/29 = 8 IPs, 182-191, 190 is the last Assignable IP on that Subnet, so /29 is picked because it is the Longest Prefix route INCLUSIVE of the IP address. And the next hop IP for that is C. 192.168.7.35

comments.content:
Did you mistype above? 184-191, with 185-190 usable.
Answer: C

discussion.content:
Excluding all the description about load-balancing traffic, etc etc... the bottom line is what is the next hop of address 172.16.1.190? Answer is C.192.168.7.35.
How I got it?
 /29 subnet(/32 minus /29 equals to 3 subnet bits)
Now take 2 to the power of 3 youll have 8 subnets and for host just minus 2 which is 6 hosts(for network & broadcast subnet ID, ITS A MUST)
So, in the network address 172.16.1.184....starting address is 172.16.1.185 all the way to 172.16.1.191 thus the 172.16.1.190 host is able to be allocated to this network ID(172.16.1.184). That's how you'll get your answer. Good Luck to all.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Load-balanced traffic is coming in from the WAN destined to a host at 172.16.1.190. Which next-hop is used by the router to forward the request?

choices.B: It provides traffic load balancing to destinations that are more than two hops from the source.
choices.A: It provides the default gateway redundancy on a LAN using two or more routers.
choices.C: It prevents loops in a Layer 2 LAN by forwarding all traffic to a root bridge, which then makes the final forwarding decision.
choices.D: It allows neighbors to share routing table information between each other.

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of VRRP?

discussion.content: A is the correct

Selected Answer: A
VRRP (Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol) is a protocol used to increase the availability of the default gateway on a LAN by allowing multiple routers to work together as a single virtual router.
If the primary router fails, another router in the group automatically takes over, ensuring uninterrupted gateway services.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
Router with the highest OSPF interface priority in a segment becomes the DR.

Selected Answer: D
Int G0/1 up ospf priority 100

Answer: D
Explanation:
- Router with the highest OSPF interface priority on a segment becomes the DR.
 This is provided using the interface command: ip ospf priority <0 - 255>
 The default OSPF priority is 1.
- Router with the next highest OSPF interface priority becomes the BDR.
- If router priorities are equal, the highest Router ID (RID) breaks the tie.
 - The OSPF Router ID for a router is found by:
 1. The router-id <ip-address> config-router command.
 2. If that doesn’t exist, then the highest IP address on a loopback is used.
 3. If that doesn’t exist, then the highest IP address on an up physical is used.

discussion.content: Why not C the correct answer?

comments.content:
This is not spanning tree protocol where 0 becomes the highest priority. 
In the case of OSPF, 0 means you will never be elected as DR or BDR. Default priority is 1.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Highest Priority interface becomes the DR. So it would be 100 since it is higher than 99 in this case.
I would have thought setting the loopback on R3 with a higher priority of 100 would have got DR.Why choose setting the main interface with the higher priority?
Los routers en la red seleccionan como DR al router con la prioridad de interfaz más alta. El router con la segunda prioridad de interfaz más alta se elige como BDR.
